page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY & CUSTOMS.
page.content: {An ANCIENT BRITISH HILL FORT}on Bonchester Hill is the earliest known habitation.{HOBKIRK }means"The church in the narrow valley"and a church is known to have been on or near its present site since 1045,and probably earlier.It appears that the area was more densely populated up until earlier this century,and indeed the old school log book shows that there was a great deal of mobility amongst the farm workers as well.The only true {CUSTOM}to survive is the Bonchester Ba' Day.This is a handball game played by the men of the district in February of each year.It is usually very muddy and rough,but good humoured.It starts from the wall by the old school and church.There is also a {RIDE-OUT}from the {HAWICK COMMON RIDING}to Bonchester Bridge once a year,which draws a very big crowd.
